docs.lead_paragraph: The State Supreme Court, in a 3-to-2 decision, upheld the homicide conviction of a woman whose cocaine use killed a fetus she was carrying. The woman, Regina D. McKnight, who gave birth to a stillborn five-pound girl around the 35th week of her pregnancy, was sentenced to 12 years in prison. The dissenting judges said the Legislature did not intend the homicide-by-child-abuse law under which Ms. McKnight was convicted to apply to fetuses. Adam Liptak (NYT)

headline.main: National Briefing | South: South Carolina: 12-Year Sentence In Death Of Fetus

docs.abstract: South Carolina Supreme Court, in 3-to-2 decision, upholds homicide conviction of Regina D McKnight, whose cocaine use killed fetus she was carrying; she was convicted under state's homicide-by-child abuse law and has been sentenced to 12 years in prison (S)
